skillTree.localised_description: The mount of any self-respecting Arabyan gentleman.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: A Djinn bound to a piece of furniture to make it fly.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: From atop this wondrous carriage, the Vizier calls upon the elemental spirits to aid his armies.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Even from within their vessels the Djinn will protect their masters.
The relentless drive and fury of the elemental spirits, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Despite the slander that envious men like to spread, most Grand Viziers in Araby are loyal servants to their lieges and dedicated administrators of their assigned provinces.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Many Grand Viziers reach their lofty positions thanks to both their knowledge in the magical arts and their advances in the sciences, for in Araby there's little difference between the study of the natural world and the supernatural world.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: The rumours about the dubious moral integrity of Arabyan Grand Viziers are not entirely unfounded, for there are many among them who abuse their privileges to indulge in the study of the Dark Arts.

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: +15% for all enemy spellcasters
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: The sorcerer creates the illusion of a huge host of fearsome warriors, bearing down inexorably upon his startled foes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of illusionary Spearmen

effects.description: Spell number of uses: +1 for "Mirage" and "Mirage Upgraded"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of illusionary Spearmen

skillTree.localised_description: The caster calls on the elements of the desert and draws upon the fortune they can bestow.
By invoking the Element of Fire, one of the caster's hands becomes burning hot, which he can use to smite enemies.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Burning Hand"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Burning Hand Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Burning Hand Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The sorcerer channels the immense power of the Djinn through his own body and lays a terrible curse upon his foes.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Curse of the Djinn Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Bright beams of burning energy leap from the sorcerer's eyes and scythe through all before him.

Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Sunstrike Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By invoking the Element of Water, moisture rises up from the very rocks and sand, turning the ground into deadly quicksand.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Quicksand Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Commanding the Desert Spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Sandstorm Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Warriors of great armies are decorated in ornate armour taken from the Sultan's personal armoury, even the slaves!

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%
